cluster.display: How do nitrogen-fixers change nitrogen to form a new, usable compound?
cluster.response: They combine nitrogen with another element
cluster.falseResponse: They force apart the bond between nitrogen atoms
They give nitrogen a positive charge
They fix nitrogen to clay particles in the soil

cluster.display: What is nitrogen uptake?
cluster.response: When plant roots bring fixed nitrogen, like ammonium, into the plant body
cluster.falseResponse: The removal of fixed nitrogen, like ammonium, from a plant

cluster.display: How does nitrogen mineralization return organic nitrogen to the environment?
cluster.response: A plant or animal dies, decomposes, and its nitrogen becomes ammonium to be reused in the soil
cluster.falseResponse: A plant absorbs nitrogen from minerals in the soil and uses it to make and release seeds
Fossils of dead plants release their nitrogen back into the soil as nitrate over thousands of years
Rocks and minerals absorb nitrogen from the air and leach it in the soil
